website_summaries.verdict: Throwback introductory chemistry set that walks students through the basics.
pros: Includes topics like acids and bases and states of matter
Comes with beakers, goggles, and more
cons: Requires some chemicals that are not included

customer_reviews.title: and they will just end up confused and disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Parents, this is not something you can just let your kid unwrap on their birthday or Christmas and expect it to be ready for them to play with on their own. Parents should read the instruction manual and buy the other ingredients (denatured alcohol, 9-volt battery) BEFORE you give this to your kids. Otherwise they will be so eager to use it, start bumbling their way through it, doing experiments out of order because they don't have the ingredients, and they will just end up confused and disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic kit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my 10yo son who was interested in chemistry. He was able to complete some of the projects with his 18yo brothers assistance. It's a very nice basic kit which requires supervision. I would recommend this to anyone. Looking for a starter kit.
customer_reviews.author: Florida671

customer_reviews.title: Fun Science
customer_reviews.text: My 8-year old son and 11-year old daughter loved this set, which was a gift. My only disappointment is that I had to go out and find denatured alcohol (not the same as isopropyl) that is needed for the litmus solution to do many of the cooler experiments. An adult is definitely needed for this set I’d say for anyone under 14, but it was a great opportunity to connect and learn and work together.
customer_reviews.author: mr. cotter

customer_reviews.title: not an open and play type thing
customer_reviews.text: When my kids got this for Christmas he was so excited and wanted to do some experiments, however there were some chemicals needed that were not included to perform such experiements. Still a cool kit and he likes it, just a bit difficult to find the things you need to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: David Hamill

customer_reviews.title: my husband and our grand daughter LOVE it. It is brought out whenever she visits
customer_reviews.text: my husband and our grand daughter LOVE it. It is brought out whenever she visits, and it keeps them occupied for almost 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Petito

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, hands-on exploratory kit for the little scientists. It also has good supplies that can be used long after the one-use items (like baking soda and other safe chemicals) are gone. Great time for kids!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Worst chemistry set I’ve seen.
customer_reviews.text: Directions are straight forward and it’s basic chemistry. Well, using their material the reactions were extremely weak practically none existent. I would highly urge your to look for a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Cory c

customer_reviews.title: You'll have to buy more ingredients for experiments
customer_reviews.text: It included a lot of different experiments but some require ingredients not included in the set
customer_reviews.author: Kian Kludsikofsky

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: This is second kids chemistry kit I have purchased from Amazon for my 9 year old grandson. The first one "Color Chemistry" was a lot of fun - we both enjoyed doing the experiments. This new one (above) is not really fun at all. Some of the experiments literally result in nothing happened or at least very little. In addition, it calls for you to have on hand things that the average person would not have (mineral and distilled water, denatured alcohol (even after googling this I'm not sure what it is or where to buy it). So, for us it was a bust (esp. since it was one of his birthday presents).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Zirkle

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging, spilling chemicals
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter, and when we finally opened the box to do an experiment, we noticed that one of the chemicals (yellow powder) had spread throughout the materials and contaminated everything. The directions commented that the potassium substance (the only yellow substance included, which is spread through out the packaging on all the items) was especially toxic and should be handled with extra care. Bummer! Glad I was the one that opened it and not my child! The manufacturer should take more care in packaging these products.
customer_reviews.author: EphrAim Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Came in time for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves the set. It came to us well packaged and all the items needed were inside. Nothing was missing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ann C. Polk

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!
customer_reviews.text: My kids were sadly dissatisfied. This was well below the age rating. They could have been more stimulated by vinegar and baking soda. In all fairness i should have read the details before buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Emergy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing packaging
customer_reviews.text: Contents seem fine but the packaging is third world. Originally planned to give as a back to school gift but this seems like a very seedy looking product. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Tre'mendous

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: Not bad product. Should have more experiments for the price
customer_reviews.author: Kenah

customer_reviews.title: but it was received in very poor condition. It was not delivered in a box ...
customer_reviews.text: This was meant to be a gift, but it was received in very poor condition. It was not delivered in a box nor was the manual received. I am now left with a set of items that serve no purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Gyan

customer_reviews.title: Seems fun.
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my little brother for Christmas. hoping he'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Hard

customer_reviews.title: Gift for grandchildren and they enjoyed it except for the fact that they had to ...
customer_reviews.text: Gift for grandchildren and they enjoyed it except for the fact that they had to supply most of the products for the experiments. You'd think for that price there would be more in the kit!
customer_reviews.author: William C

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves science, and these kits, they are great for keeping kids excited about learning.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja Kay Allen

customer_reviews.title: This kit is really great. My son absolutely loves it
customer_reviews.text: This kit is really great. My son absolutely loves it. There are quite a few experiments to do. However, there's a lot of different things you need to buy in order to do most of them. Other than that, it's great for getting your child interested in experiments and it's great family fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ink'd

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a child that is in to science, this is the kit to get them! My son loves it! Some of the experiments do require adult supervision, but, for the most part, a 11-12 year old child can do these with minimal supervision!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My grandchild loved it!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is entering 6th grade and is turning into something of a science nerd. He loves natural science and chemical science so I thought he would like this set as a place to begin. So far, all of his experiments have been successful and he hasn't blown up the house. It made a good birthday present for him.
customer_reviews.author: Edith Ritchison

customer_reviews.title: Fascinating for 12-year old grandson.
customer_reviews.text: Takes only an afternoon to do all the experiments - I wish it would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my 7 yr old unschooled grandson. He enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Asdah

customer_reviews.title: Amazon has everything
customer_reviews.text: Again the child loved this. He was excited to do these experiments as soon as he opened the gift.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: this was a great success!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my young grand daughter, who loves this chemistry set and is very excited about doing experiments. So, from a child's viewpoint, this was a great success!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel RichTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good set for any beginning child chemist. The instructions for the experiments are very detailed and promotes learning how to follow directions as well as teaches basic chemistry concepts.
customer_reviews.author: Nino Brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good fun - you do need to acquire some supplies elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: R. R. Vroman

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: Definitely would recommend it. My daughter whose only 11 love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ging

customer_reviews.title: 10-13 year olds
customer_reviews.text: My 6th grade dsughter is having lots of fun with this. For the most part she does it all herself.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent beginners chemistry set, great directions, needs more vials
customer_reviews.text: I had brought this for my 6 year old daughter so we can do science projects on rainy days. It comes with safety goggles and very clear directions for multiple projects that you can do. The only downfall is that it needs to come with more vials. They are hard to dry and when you are having fun you have to stop to let them air dry from one project to the next. My daughter loves it and I must say I have a great time with her watching her mix the chemicals and see the different reactions
customer_reviews.author: James Taz

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and in good condition. Pay attention to the age limit on this set. It does contain some reagents that are harmful.
customer_reviews.author: S. Birdsell

customer_reviews.title: The perfect gift for any tween
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has spent hours experimenting with this set! The perfect gift for any tween!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Gift was finally opened and we tried to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: Gift was finally opened and we tried to use it today, only to find that one of the chemical bottles (litmus powder) had opened. (I personally opened the shrink-wrap for my 10 year old son, so I know he didn't do it.) This is a key chemical in the kit. The kit is seriously flawed without this chemical. We just missed the 30 day return window too. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: ERNEST

customer_reviews.title: Our grandson enjoyed it. The box had a picture of a ...
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson enjoyed it. The box had a picture of a beaker, none was included. Otherwise it was very good.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L. Bower

customer_reviews.title: He loved it, but did everything in about a week
customer_reviews.text: Gift for son. He loved it, but did everything in about a week.

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby
customer_reviews.text: Kid loved it, provided hours entertainment away from a screen.
customer_reviews.author: L R

customer_reviews.title: great begining
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter kit. Could use a couple more test tubes for the price. My granddaughter enjoyed it very much. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: rare finds

customer_reviews.title: challenging and interesting for my 12 year old grandson - took him away from his laptop for a good few hours
customer_reviews.text: Comprehensive set, challenging and interesting for my 12 year old grandson - took him away from his laptop for a good few hours.....
customer_reviews.author: Sandrats

customer_reviews.title: I think the company is great and I do recommend the kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent start kit, but in hindsight I would have purchased the larger kit. This requires a significant amount of ingredients from your own kitchen and house (vinegar, paper, paint brushes, distilled water, etc.) and only ships with 4 chemicals to do the experiments with. You are effectively paying for a well written experiments book, a few test tubes, a dropper, and a then a few chemicals one of which is simply baking soda. I think the company is great and I do recommend the kit, but I would purchase the larger kit to have more experiments and, more importantly, ingredients/tools to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Redding

customer_reviews.title: Loved it! Was a lot of fun for budding ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! Was a lot of fun for budding chemist!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kid (+ Adult Lab Partner) = Cool science fun
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Great stimulating kit for kids interested in experimenting but do NOT let them take it to their rooms. In the Christmas frenzy my 10 y/o son made off with it & began conducting independent experiments in his private lab (aka bathroom he's supposed to share with his sister). Come to find out there are actual chemicals & glass beakers (see my DustBuster review). Once I had a chance to review the contents the rule became no solo experiments and I am now his mandatory lab partner. Very cool real lab type protocols to follow - great prep for science classes with lab & also teaches the importance of following directions (or your experiment will fail).
customer_reviews.author: Fancy and Fierce

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is the main gift my 10 year old Grandson wanted for Christmas. He loves chemistry, science anything new. It was so cute seeing the photos of him doing experiments with his test tubes and mask on. Quite a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Adamski

customer_reviews.title: Not everything is included
customer_reviews.text: Seems tho be a good kit but doesn't give you all the supplies you need to do experiments. Most extra items needed are basic household things. But I wish I'd known I might have picked a different kit. I didn't want extra work ;) I was trying to buy something my girl could take and run with. Now I've got extra store trips :/ for a busy mom that's not always helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Electra Caddell

customer_reviews.title: Chemistry set
customer_reviews.text: Good Experiments. Not like the the kits of our childhood because those would be deemed unsafe with their ingredients and experiments in this litigious day. I would say this is a good value for what you get. My 10 year old grandson enjoyed doing experiments with his grandfathers help
customer_reviews.author: becky dangelo

customer_reviews.title: Several experiments with good explanations; would recommend parent help to set up ...
customer_reviews.text: what I expected from the descriptions. Several experiments with good explanations; would recommend parent help to set up experiments for kids <11 years old
customer_reviews.author: kinta  m culton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome learning tool that is tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old says this is "the best present ever!" She is having an absolute blast learning about acids and bases, and loves doing the expriments. This set has given her the basic knowledge and curiosity to start asking a million "what happens if..." questions and start researching answers and further experiments. What a great learning tool. Her little brother and sister are asking for science kits for their birthdays now. I couldn't be more thrilled. We will definitely be buying more sets from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Haffner

customer_reviews.title: Dried Out
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that some of the chemicals were dried out and hard as a rock, but other than having to try to break it apart my kids loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Blagg

customer_reviews.title: Over all I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: A little small but my 11 year old boy has been enjoying the experiments. Over all I would recommend this product. It arrived just a couple of days after I ordered it.

customer_reviews.title: This was a great gift for the Grandson and he couldn't wait to ...

customer_reviews.title: Was fun
customer_reviews.text: My 7th grade homeschool student had fun using this set. He and his cousin took the time to read instructions. The goggles need to be bigger or more adjustable. They used sunglasses instead.
customer_reviews.author: DG7915

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for Xmas....
customer_reviews.text: ....and the boy hasn't blown himself up...yet. I am hoping he can do a full titration, or possibly synthesize luminol. But if it keeps him off the screens for an hour or so it is a major victory.
customer_reviews.author: Vomit

customer_reviews.title: Decent starter kit
customer_reviews.text: The only thing missing is some denatured alcohol, which can be purchased in the paint department at your local hardware or home improvement store, near the mineral spirits and stripping agents. It does require supervision, but none of the chemicals are particularly volitile. It makes learning lab behavior easy and safe and prepares the budding chemist for a more advanced kit.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a budding scientist
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old daughter. Great gift for a budding scientist. Easy instructions but the kit did require us to gather other items not contained int he kit such as denatured alcohol, white vinegar etc.
customer_reviews.author: karla + gabby

customer_reviews.title: Very NEW to computer & Amazon but trying!
customer_reviews.text: It was for my grandson & he luvs it! & that's all I care about!

customer_reviews.title: simple and the kids love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great for teaching simple chemistry concepts to kids, our 5 and 6 yr olds love it. Would definitely do business again.

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR 8 YEAR OLDS!
customer_reviews.text: MY 8 year old son wanted this badly. This is not something any 8 year old can do by themselves. There are some dangerous chemicals In here and after reading all of the precautions on how to handle and dispose of and not to breath in the power dust, I was a little scared to use it myself! My husband did a few of these experiments but fussed at me for buying this for him. It may be more appropriate for kids a bit older with supervision.
customer_reviews.author: petlovr

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what is in it
customer_reviews.text: There are not many experiments to do. There is no measuring device to measure 1 cm or 5 cm, as directions say.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased set as a birthday gift for my niece.
customer_reviews.text: Sent to my 10 year old niece. She loved it! Spent a lot of time using it and seems interested in using it over and over.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the product
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the product. Purchased it as a gift for a 10 year old but ended up getting something else. It's very light and contains only a handful of things, It seems there are some component missing but no, that's just all. Not a good value.
customer_reviews.author: lauraand

customer_reviews.title: Good packaging. My only disappointment is that I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery. Good packaging. My only disappointment is that I was remembering the chemistry sets I had a a child when I ordered this for my grandchild. I do realize that probably liability issues and terrorism issues (probably predicated by the idiots at Homeland Security) re probably the culprits. But the chemistry sets sold today don't have that much in them. My grandchild is enjoying this but I'm biting my tongue to keep from saying, "You should have seen the kits we had when I was a kid."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It is what you make of it. If you use it for little kids and make it a learning experience, it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: better than playing with gaming device's
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this set. Keeps him entertained. This keeps him from always playing with gaming device's. And he is also being educated.

customer_reviews.title: and I like the kit
customer_reviews.text: It is my 8 year old son's first kit, I am present when he makes the experiments, and I like the kit. It is just what I was looking for. He also has a microscope and everything we do with the kit, he wants to check it out on the microscope and I am happy he is using it more often.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Thames & Kosmos Chem Set
customer_reviews.text: We bought this chemistry set for our 11 year old grandson who is very interested in "how things work". There are sufficient basic experiments to keep him entertained for many hours and to teach him the basic principles he will use in later experiments in science class. He is currently studying at the 8th grade level in chemistry and the product, though a toy, kept his interest. I am very satisfied with our purchase.

customer_reviews.title: and it was easy to find on amazon and very price competitive

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a random child. She was overjoyed with the set. Now she will be the worlds greatest Chemist!

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: This kit does not include much, and what it does include is cheap. It is overpriced and not a good value. It has a list of 22 "additional things you will need", which far outnumbers the list of things included in the kit. If you buy this kit, plan on going to the store and spending additional money to be able to run the experiments. Would not buy again.

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made

customer_reviews.title: Great learning experience but there were quite a few outside ...

customer_reviews.title: Save you money.

Save your money and google some easy experiments and you find better ones that what was in this kit. For example you can just use household vinegar and baking soda to get the same effect from the kit. plus one of the liquid filled bottles was all over the box when i received it.

customer_reviews.text: the little boy I gave it to really liked it - that is all I can tell you because I didn't see it

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun for both kids
customer_reviews.text: This kit is perfect for 7+ years with some supervision. We did all the experiments then the kids had most fun just making colors on their own. The electrical experiments were some of the most interesting. You can get a battery pack at Radio Shack to hold 8 AA batteries to give them a bit more oomph without any danger of shock.

Both my 8 & 10 year old boys are having fun as we work through the experiments in this kit. i got a few books on chemistry to go with it and we have science covered for this month!

customer_reviews.title: Chemistry Kit with 30 experiments
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old son for Christmas. He put a "Science Kit" on his wishlist and said he wanted to mix things and do experiments. This was perfect. It does need to be done with an adult as the vials are glass and it uses real acids and bases but nothing is dangerous. Great into for kids to learn to love Chemistry.
customer_reviews.author: DJMN

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad Christmas gift--not something that probably offers real science learning.
customer_reviews.text: I say it's okay...because we're a pretty science minded family and really haven't used it much. Pulled it out a couple of times...just wasn't super interesting for my then 8 year old...nor my then 41 year old husband. Still...when I look at how much use most Christmas gifts get...this got its 3 uses...so not awful. My kid's now 10...so maybe I'll pull it out and see if it sparks any interest. Of course my husband is now 43...so probably no more sparking of interest there.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hill

product_meta.title: Thames & Kosmos Chemistry Chem C500 Science Kit with 28 Guided Experiments 48 Page Science Guide Parents’ Choice Silver Award Winner
product_meta.description:

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
